stream_context.summary: Kaze blocks-out and art-passes the third overworld zone ("Fruit Beach"), tests textures, and debates Fast64 tooling changes with Lilaa while chat throws out ideas.

development_findings.summary: Work shifted from forest hub to "Area 3 – Fruit Beach," placing giant fruit props, water surface, and planning red-coin challenge.
development_findings.quote: "Alright, I think we're moving on to area three today … So this could be the famous fruit beach location."

development_findings.summary: Giant fruit props chosen because they are fast to read visually, tie to Yoshi’s Story lore, and provide varied physics (rolling melon, bouncy grapes, stationary banana).
development_findings.quote: "Big-ass fruit is like a really easy way to make something for the level … there’s already like a million ideas you can just use."

development_findings.summary: Timed red-coin mission will start from a switch on the beach; fruit behave differently to create traversal variety.
development_findings.quote: "I really do like the idea of a timed red coin challenge on fruits that have different properties."

development_findings.summary: After ~100 stars an extra fruit will spawn, evolving the overworld and unlocking a secret star.
development_findings.quote: "Next time you enter this area there's like a different fruit here that you can use to get a secret star."

development_findings.summary: Water in the enclosed lake must appear still; Kaze is experimenting with shimmer textures instead of wave animation.
development_findings.quote: "We need to do something for the water. We can't just leave it like this … Waves on a still sea? Come on."

development_findings.summary: Concern that early-game overworld jump to island ledge is too difficult; considering adding an alternative path or prop.
development_findings.quote: "For the first overworld, isn't this a little bit awkward? … I think I should put something there."

development_findings.summary: Fast64 update broke decals; Kaze notes severe flicker and will wait for a patched build before showing nightclub area.
development_findings.quote: "As expected, updating Fast64 broke the overwatch … That is the worst flickering I've ever seen."

development_findings.summary: Kaze needs Fast64 to export label indices for dynamic materials; debate ends with plan to implement custom pointer search in C code.
development_findings.quote: "I am begging. Export indices … I guess I just need to implement this in code myself."

development_findings.summary: Display-list vs segment jump method for dynamic properties discussed with Lila; Kaze rejects extra jumps to avoid memory and timing waste.
development_findings.quote: "You're writing a pointer to your display list … All you did was make us waste some time."

development_findings.summary: Fruit textures built manually in Blender; hex tiling mapped onto UV sphere for honey-melon model.
Rolling-ball physics will reuse existing egg/galaxy code; size limited so fruit doesn’t clip terrain.
development_findings.quote: "Problem if it's too huge, because how am I going to rotate it without it clipping into the floor."

context_findings.summary: Kaze still freelances for Gears for Breakfast but is under NDA about new projects.
context_findings.quote: "I still work for Gears for Breakfast … I wouldn't even be allowed to tell you whether there's one or not."

context_findings.summary: He lived in Canada and Germany; finds bureaucracy worse in Germany but everyday life similar.
context_findings.quote: "I feel basically no difference from living in Canada versus living in Germany. Except for the bureaucracy."

context_findings.summary: Displays skepticism toward small talk empathy and jokes about donations as emotional support.
context_findings.quote: "Why do you care? … Yes you can donate money, I would love money."

context_findings.summary: Fitness routine: push-pull-legs, consistent short sets during work hours to stay focused.
context_findings.quote: "It's really easy to be a little bit built … just get up once an hour and do a set."

context_findings.summary: Frustration that media covered his debug bug more than Mario Kart 64 decompilation; suspects ‘conspiracy’.
context_findings.quote: "How is my stupid debug more relevant than Mario Kart 64 decompilation being finished?"

biobak.summary: Will be absent for about two weeks due to travel to England, delaying certain graphics tasks.
biobak.quote: "England is taking Biobak from us … Bro is going to be eating beans on toast for two weeks."

biobak.summary: Updated Fast64 broke their workflow; rework of nightclub area postponed until next stream cycle.
biobak.quote: "As expected, updating Fast64 broke the overwatch … If there's another stream before Friday, maybe we can see the rework."

key_stories.title: Inventing Fruit Beach
key_stories.summary: Kaze needs a memorable third overworld zone. Chat suggests big fruit; Kaze ties it into Yoshi’s Story lore, designs rolling melon and bouncy grapes, and plans a timed red-coin star.
key_stories.challenge: Create a visually distinct, mechanically interesting beach area without overwhelming new players.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed fruit justification (Super Happy Tree), debated water look, selected fruit types, mapped melon UVs, scripted future star unlocks.
key_stories.outcome: Concrete plan: initial fruit playground with timed coin star; extra fruit spawns after 100 stars to refresh area.
key_stories.key_quote: "Maybe there's a switch and eight red coins spawn … you can only reach the switch by jumping on the fruit that spawned at 100 stars."

key_stories.title: Fast64 Dynamic Property Dispute
key_stories.summary: A tooling change removes label exports. Kaze and Lilaa argue over jump-command workaround. Kaze decides to bypass Fast64 and write pointer-search logic himself.
key_stories.challenge: Need reliable, efficient way to modify material properties at runtime without corrupting display lists.
key_stories.process: Long technical back-and-forth about segment jumps, GeoASM, and memory cost.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze will implement custom C code and hopes Fast64 later adds proper indices.
key_stories.key_quote: "I guess I just need to implement this in code myself."

key_stories.title: Media Coverage Mismatch
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s accidental menu bug gets widespread press while major Mario Kart 64 decompilation news is ignored.
key_stories.process: Shows six articles, jokes about conspiracy.
key_stories.outcome: Adds to Kaze’s sense of disconnect between his goals and public attention.
key_stories.key_quote: "There has to be some kind of conspiracy going on here."
